description: Procedo ICSID Parameters for AI Analysis

mandatory_provisions.name: Institutional Rules - Core Framework
mandatory_provisions.action: Assess compliance (complete content, proper filing). Cannot propose skipping or replacing.

mandatory_provisions.name: Application of Rules and Party Agreements
mandatory_provisions.action: Classify draft procedural order provisions as (a) rule-consistent or (b) conflicting with rules and flag accordingly.

mandatory_provisions.name: Party and Party Representatives
mandatory_provisions.action: Extract party and representative details from submissions. Flag when proper authority documentation is missing or not on record.

mandatory_provisions.name: Routing the Documents
mandatory_provisions.action: Identify documents served upon parties. Flag when documents have not been supplied to either party.

mandatory_provisions.name: Fixing Time Limits
mandatory_provisions.action: Verify time limits are expressly fixed for each procedural step. Confirm party consultation is recorded. Recommend if delegation to President will enhance efficiency.

mandatory_provisions.name: Method of Constituting the Tribunal
mandatory_provisions.action: Check: number of arbitrators specified, appointment method recorded, Secretary-General validity. Issue alert if missing. For institutions: confirm Rule 15 prerequisites, default constitution triggered correctly.

mandatory_provisions.name: Appointment of Arbitrators by Chair (Convention Rule 38)
mandatory_provisions.action: Check 90-day threshold met, alternative period agreements, party consultation evidenced. Provide note if absent: 'Rule 18(3) requires consultation with the parties as far as possible prior to appointment.'

mandatory_provisions.name: Acceptance of Appointment
mandatory_provisions.action: Check completeness of notifications, track 20-day deadline, validate procedural sequence, identify re-appointment triggers, confirm continuing disclosure obligation.

mandatory_provisions.name: Replacement of Arbitrators Prior to Constitution
mandatory_provisions.action: Confirm change before constitution, record withdrawal/replacement reason, check same appointment method used, flag delays, verify procedural file reflects steps.

mandatory_provisions.name: Disqualification of Arbitrators
mandatory_provisions.action: Mark if disqualification request received within 21 days from constitution or knowledge of facts. Highlight if response filed within 21 days.

mandatory_provisions.name: First Session
mandatory_provisions.action: Pre-Session: Check 60-day timeline, suggest complete agenda (items A-I). During: Provide checklist, flag missing items. Post: Score compliance, suggest improvements.

mandatory_provisions.name: Majority Vote
mandatory_provisions.action: Flag any procedural order or award that appears to depart from majority decision-making. Cannot propose alternatives.

mandatory_provisions.name: Hearings
mandatory_provisions.action: Check if hearing required or waived. Suggest dates/times/formats based on efficiency and party locations. Flag if parties haven't agreed on location, remind default is seat.

mandatory_provisions.name: Burden of Proof
mandatory_provisions.action: Summarize how tribunals allocate burdens in procedural orders. Cannot suggest reallocation contradicting this rule.

mandatory_provisions.name: Manifest Lack of Legal Merit
mandatory_provisions.action: Mark if objections received within 21 days from constitution. Check if decision rendered within 60 days. Score compliance, suggest improvements.

mandatory_provisions.name: Default Application of Arbitration Rules
mandatory_provisions.action: Arbitration must be conducted strictly per Convention. Cannot suggest otherwise except for party-agreed procedural issues.

mandatory_provisions.name: Award Timeline
mandatory_provisions.action: Check if 'last submission' event defined. Track date of last submission, closure, reopening, milestones. Generate 60/180/240 day countdown. Suggest checkpoints. Report timeline deviation and efficiency insights.

mandatory_provisions.name: Contents of the Award
mandatory_provisions.action: Generate structured checklist (items a-j). Flag missing items. Score: Fully Compliant (all included), Partially Compliant (some missing), Non-Compliant (critical missing).

optimizable_provisions.name: Procedural Language Choices
optimizable_provisions.action: Compare different languages and estimate translation/administrative burden. Suggest single language where both parties can reasonably operate, subject to fairness concerns.

optimizable_provisions.name: Tribunal's Power to Call for Evidence
optimizable_provisions.action: Flag where multiple subsequent requests may hurt the timeframe of proceedings.

optimizable_provisions.name: Bifurcation
optimizable_provisions.action: Show historical data: cases where bifurcation shortened or lengthened overall proceedings. Inform tribunal discretion.

optimizable_provisions.name: Preliminary Objections (Timing and Procedure)
optimizable_provisions.action: Evaluate whether multiple separate objection phases or overlapping merits submissions are optimal. Propose consolidated or slimmer timetables.

optimizable_provisions.name: Expedited Arbitration Regime
optimizable_provisions.action: Advise on suitability of expedited regime based on complexity. Monitor compliance with expedited deadlines. Suggest procedural simplifications (written-only phases, limited witness lists).

critical_flags_categories.description: Categories of critical issues that must be flagged during analysis

categories.detection_criteria: Issues that may invalidate the tribunal's authority to hear the case
Violations of mandatory procedural requirements that could lead to annulment
Failure to comply with mandatory time limits under applicable rules
Issues related to evidence handling that violate fundamental fairness
Issues with party representation that may affect validity of proceedings
Award does not meet mandatory content requirements under applicable rules
Issues with costs, fees, or financial aspects of the arbitration
